Text: Espionage?

One day, after completing a mission, Zeta returns
to Shadow Garden HQ for the first time in a while.
An apologetic-looking Alpha stops her...

Sorry to stop you when you just got back, but could I
ask a favor of you?
Sure.
I know you must be tired, but I simplyâ€”huh?

Are you sure? I haven't even told you what the
request is yet, and you accepted it so readily...
It's not like I've got any other plans.

Besides, if you had to ask me the minute I returned,
that must mean it's a task the others can't do.

Exactly... None of them are all that proficient in
espionage.

I'm so glad you readily agreed to it, Zeta. Now, let
me get straight to telling you what the task entails.
Alpha lays a map out on the table.

Right here...see this area around the old ruins?
We received intelligence that the Cult has been
on the move over there.
Is there something noteworthy around those ruins?

There's either something in those ruins or something
in the village or town near them.

Ahh, that makes sense. So you're saying that much is
unknown at present.

Yes. But since the Cult might be involved, it is
a situation we cannot ignore.

It might be a trap, tooâ€”could you start your
investigation immediately?
Copy that.

And with a short answer and a spring in her step,
Zeta left HQ again, barely after she'd returned.
Several days laterâ€”

Zeta is surveying the area that was marked as a point
of interest for the Cult.
Hmmm...

(I did find traces of the Cult at the ruins, but they
were decayed, and I couldn't gain any useable
intel from them.)

(Maybe Alpha's intel was just too old. Well, that
sort of thing happens a lot...)

(If the intel is still at all useful, the only other
thing that's fishy is the residential area...)

Zeta enters the tiny town marked on the map, blending
into the darkness of night to commence her operation.

(The Cult's church is there, but I see nothing else
of interest. For better or worse, it just feels like a
typical church in the middle of the countryside.)
(The bar...also looks normal.)

(The only thing that's noteworthy is the tomato-fish
dishâ€”that looks yummyâ€”otherwise, there's no
signs of an informant or strange Cult activities.)
(Ah. The priest is drinking.)

From what Zeta can see, there is nothing amiss. It is
a quaint town you could find anywhere.
(I wanna get a bird's-eye view.)

After circling the area, she approaches the tallest
building she can find.
It is a mansion where the town's elite live.

Zeta sneaks onto the property, making her way up to
the roof by the use of the trees and the wall.

(This mansion may be old, but it's really well-built.
So the Cult could be after the person who lives
here...maybe to get funding?)
(Hmm?!)

Inferring the Cult's objective from her spot on the
roof, Zeta looks down just in time to see someone
walk out into the big garden below.
(Well, what have we here...)
(It's a...dark knight?)

There is a young woman illuminated in the moonlight.
She is holding a sword, and she has an air of dignity
that can be seen even from a distance.

From the way she quietly stands still, you can see
the strength radiating from her.
(Could she be what the Cult is after?)
What...?!

It is quite a distance to the garden. Nevertheless,
the dark knight slowly turns her head and looks up
at Zeta.
(She noticed me? From this distance?)
(She must be a formidable foe, then.)

Zeta smirks to herself. Someone skilled enough to
notice her. Her curiosity piqued, Zeta silently kicks
herself off the roof...
Good evening.
Zeta lands in front of the dark knight.

At a closer glance, the dark knight is much younger
than she had looked from up above.
What...?!
Shh! Please be quiet.

Zeta grabs the girl's hand to stop her from drawing
her sword. She leans in close, and the girl's eyes
open wide.

C'mon, don't act so surprised. I know you noticed me
up there.
Huh...?
Up there...on the roof. You saw me, didn't you?
How did you sense my presence?
What...are you talking about?

I just sensed...a slight disturbance in the wind and
happened to look up...
I did not see you there.
Really?
Zeta blinks in disbelief at the girl.
(Oh...so she didn't actually sense me there.)

(In other words, there was no need for me to reveal
myself to her. Guess I jumped the gun there...)

Zeta is holding the girl's handâ€”sword and allâ€”and
gripping them tight.
(Okaaay...what do I do now?)

(There'll be trouble if she screams...I guess I'd
better take care of her before that happens.)
(In an instant...)
Are you...trying to kill me?
What do you think?

I don't exactly need to ask... Even now, you look
like you're about to off me.
Well...you're correct.

I won't fight back...and I won't scream for help
either.

Zeta stares hard into the dark knight's eyes,
searching for the truth.
(Doesn't look like she's lying...)

I know there's a huge power difference between us.
I won't try to do anything foolish.
It's all good... I'll let you escape.
Zeta releases the girl's hand and steps back.

But she is still at a distance where she can fight
back. Noticing this, the girl keeps the sour frown
on her face.

You're much more reasonable than I thought you'd be.
At first, you had the vibe of someone who wouldn't let
intruders survive.

I am not the sort of fool who mistakes recklessness
for bravery.

As heiress to this mansion, the importance of
discerning the truth has been drilled into me.
Ohh. So you're a rich heiress, then.
From your vibe, I thought you were a bodyguard.
Ah...

The girl is nervous, yet she is clearly trying to
project an air of calmness... This only makes
Zeta even more drawn to her.
(She might be fun.)

(And if this mansion is what the Cult is after,
talking with this girl won't be for nothing either.)

Hey, Heiress. The night is young. Let's talk a bit
longer.
Do I...look like I'm in a position to refuse?

When the dark knightâ€”the heiressâ€”asks her question,
Zeta smirks in response.
